info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 2:05PM CDT until July 7 at 5:05AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas...
Colorado River Near San Saba affecting San Saba and Lampasas Counties.
For the Colorado River...including Silver, Robert Lee, Ballinger, Stacy, Winchell, San Saba...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Colorado River near San Saba.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, Major flooding will occur. Roads and low water crossings will be flooded and impassible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:35 PM CDT Friday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 37.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.3 feet on 05/14/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
